src:
DK Shivakumar admitted to hospital
01 Nov 2019, 17:55 by Bangalore Mirror Bureau
Former minister and Congress leader DK Shivakumar was admitted to a hospital after complaining chest pain and fluctuations in blood pressure. According to close aides of Shivakumar, he was suffering from backache for the last two days. “On Friday after attending a Kannada Rajyotsava programme, he complained of chest pain and giddiness. Following this, the former minister was taken to a hospital in Seshadripuram, where doctors after detailed tests, decided to admit him for further treatment.'' Shivakumar was in judicial custody in Tihar Jail in a money laundering case and is now out on bail.
text:
DK Shivakumar admitted to hospital
01 Nov 2019, 17:55 by Bangalore Mirror Bureau
Former minister and Congress leader DK Shivakumar was admitted to a hospital after complaining chest pain and fluctuations in blood pressure. According to close aides of Shivakumar, he was suffering from backache for the last two days. “On Friday after attending a Kannada Rajyotsava programme, he complained of chest pain and giddiness. Following this, the former minister was taken to a hospital in Seshadripuram, where doctors after detailed tests, decided to admit him for further treatment.'' Shivakumar was in judicial custody in Tihar Jail in a money laundering case and is now out on bail.
